div.l: And on an horse the sakke he cast anon̄
Forth Aleyn the clerc and also Iohn
With gode swerd and bokeler by his side
Iohn knewe the wey him neded no gide
And at the mille the sak a doun̄ he hath laithhathlaith
Aleyn spake first al heil symon in faith
Hou fares thi faire douȝter and thi wif
Aleyn welcome qduod Symkyn be my lif
And Iohn Also hou now what do ye here
By god qduod Iohn Symond nede has no pere
Him behoueth serue him self that hath no swayn
Orellis he is a fole as clerkes seyn
Oure Manciple I hope he wil be ded
Swa werkes ay the wanges in his hed
And therfor am I come and eke Aleyn
To grynde oure corn̄ ⁊and carie it hom agein
I pray you spede us hen that we may
It shal be don qduod Symkyn be my fay
What wol ye don whiles it is hande
By god riȝt by the hoper wil I stonde
Qduod Iohn and see hou the corn gos yn
Yet saw I neuer be my fader kyn
Hou that the hoper waggeth to and fro
Aleyn answerid Iohn wilt thou so
Than wol I be binethe be my croune
And see hou that the mele fallith adoun̄
In to the trouȝ that shal be my disport
For Iohn in faith I may bene of your soort
I am as euell a meller as ar ye
This meller smiled of her nycete
And thouȝt al this nys don̄ but for a wile
They wene that noman may hem bigile
But by my thrift yet shal I blere here ye
For all the sleiȝt in her philosophie
